meanings.def: a single thin piece of thread, wire, hair, etc.
examples: He pulled at a loose strand of wool in his sweater.
a few strands of dark hair
She wore a single strand of pearls around her neck.
He brushed a strand of hair from my face.
She pushed a stray strand of hair out of her eyes.
She tucked a strand of long dark hair behind her ear.
She wove the four coloured strands together into a ribbon.
Thin strands of copper wire can be bent easily.

meanings.def: one of the different parts of an idea, a plan, a story, etc.
examples: We heard every strand of political opinion.
The author draws the different strands of the plot together in the final chapter.
There are three main strands to the policy.
There are various strands in feminist thinking.

meanings.def: the land along the edge of the sea or ocean, or of a lake or river
to leave somebody in a place from which they have no way of leaving
examples: The strike left hundreds of tourists stranded at the airport.

meanings.def: to make a boat, fish, whale, etc. be left on land and unable to return to the water
examples: The ship was stranded on a sandbank.
